Answer module¶

For working with answers to the questions you can use the Answer module:

Answer evaluation:

  1. it's definitely a replicant (1 score)

  2. it's could be a human or a replicant (2 score)

  3. it's definitely a human (3 score)

class Answer.Answer(question, answer_options: dict)¶

Answer class is used for representing a answer of respondent

Attributes

Parameters:

  • question (string) -- asked question

  • answer_options (dict) -- dict with possible variants of answers

  • AnswerException (class) -- custom exception for Answer class

Methods

take_answer()

Takes answer from respondent

read_input()

Reads answer from standart input

check_answer()

Checks respondent's answer for validity

exception AnswerException(message)¶

Custom exception for Answer inherited from Exception

Attributes

Parameters:

message (string) -- exception message

check_answer()¶

Checks respondent's answer for validity: answer could be just number of possible variants of answers

Raises:

Answer.AnswerException -- if answer out of range

read_input()¶

Reads answer from standart input: expects just integers

Raises:

Answer.AnswerException -- if answer isn't integer

take_answer()¶

Takes answer from respondent: looping until answer willn't be valid

class Answer.AnswersKeeper¶

AnswersKeeper class is keeping given respondent's answers

Methods

save_answer()

Appends answer to dict of answers

save_answer(question, answer)¶

Appends answer to dict of answers: inserts new answer

Voight-Kampff test
